intro: Coppensia diamantinensis, commonly known as the Diamond Hill hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open areas and is adapted to well-drained soils. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Coppensia diamantinensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in gardens.
